findings.rationale: Joint ownership of work product may lead to disputes over rights and usage of intellectual property created during employment.
findings.evidence_quote: Work product created during employment is jointly owned by Employer and Employee, with Employer receiving an exclusive license for business use.

findings.rationale: Confidentiality obligations lasting for 3 years post-termination may hinder the employee's ability to work in the industry.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations survive termination and continue for 3 years.

findings.rationale: A 1-year non-compete clause can significantly restrict the employee's future employment opportunities in the same industry.
findings.evidence_quote: Employee may not compete within the same industry for 1 year after termination, within Employer's primary market area.

findings.rationale: Capping indemnification at annual compensation may expose the employee to significant liability in case of negligence.
findings.evidence_quote: Mutual indemnification: each party indemnifies the other for its own negligence, capped at annual compensation.
